message.message-text: Unable to find a valid Control block in the design.
message.suggestion: The Control block must be at the top level.

message.message-text: Multiple Control blocks found in the design.
message.suggestion: There should only be one Control block in the design. It must be at the top level.

message.message-text: Multiple Bus Stimulus blocks found in the design.
message.suggestion: There should only be one Bus Stimulus block in the design. It must be at the top level.

message.message-text: Unable to find a valid Signals block in the design.
message.suggestion: The Signals block must be at the top level.

message.message-text: Multiple Signals blocks found in the design.
message.suggestion: There should only be one Signals block in the design. It must be at the top level.

message.message-text: Illegal combination of device blocks found in '%subsystem1%' and '%subsystem2%'.
message.suggestion: Only one device block is permitted in each subsystem. Remove the device blocks in the lowest level subsystem.

parameter.name: subsystem1
parameter.description: The first subsystem containing a device block

parameter.name: subsystem2
parameter.description: The second subsystem containing a device block

message.message-text: Found device block at the top level of the model.
message.suggestion: Device blocks must be within subsystems. Move this device block out of the top level of the model.

message.message-text: Can not convert string data.
Cannot convert type's string data on [%path%], input port %port%.
Cannot convert type's string data on [%path%], output port %port%.
The reciprocal block is no longer supported.
The divide block is no longer supported.
Handle for block '%blockname%' (%blocknumber%) is not a scalar double.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: The name of the block with the invalid handle

parameter.name: blocknumber
parameter.description: The index of the block with the invalid handle

message.message-text: Cannot find any Channel-In or GP-In blocks in the design.
message.suggestion: Either add Channel-In or GP-In blocks, or disable the automatic testbench.

message.message-text: Cannot find any Channel-Out or GP-Out blocks in the design.
message.suggestion: Either add Channel-Out or GP-Out blocks, or disable the automatic testbench.

message.message-text: The read and write ports given for '%memoryname%' list a memory that is not declared.

parameter.name: memoryname
parameter.description: The simulink path to the memory unit that hasnt been declared

message.message-text: Multiple instances of External Memory block are assigned the same identifier
External Memory Read/Write blocks '%block1%' and '%block2%' have the same name '%name%', these blocks should be uniquely named in the design
Block '%blockname%' has no Library Reference - cannot synthesise it.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: The name of the block with no library reference

message.message-text: [%block%] Unknown loop test: "%testvalue%"

parameter.name: testvalue
parameter.description: The test that is trying to be carried out

message.message-text: [%block%] Invalid number of Fifo vector parameters.
message.suggestion: Fifo needs 3 or 4 parameters in a vector eg. [32 4 16]

message.message-text: Clock rate is too high.
The system clock frequency %sysfreq% is not a multiple of the bus clock frequency %busfreq%.

parameter.name: sysfreq
parameter.description: The frequency of the system clock.

parameter.name: busfreq
parameter.description: The frequency of the bus clock.

message.message-text: The system clock frequency %sysfreq% is not a positive number.
message.suggestion: Specify a positive number.

parameter.name: sysfreq
parameter.description: The frequency of the system clock.

message.message-text: The bus clock frequency %busfreq% is not a positive number.
message.suggestion: Specify a positive number.

parameter.name: busfreq
parameter.description: The frequency of the bus clock.

message.message-text: The Real-Imag To Complex block '%blockname%' has unsupported input type.
message.suggestion: Use input type 'Real and imag' and create the appropriate constant zero inputs to the block.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: The real-imag to complex block in question.

message.message-text: The Complex To Real-Imag block '%blockname%' has unsupported input type.
message.suggestion: Use input type 'Real and imag' and create the appropriate constant zero inputs to the block.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: The complex to real-imag block in question.

message.message-text: The Selector block '%blockname%' has a non-inherited 'Sample time'. Only inherited sample times are currently supported (-1).
Cannot find device directory.
Error parsing %filename%: line %line%, column %column%: %error%.

parameter.description: The devices file with the error.

parameter.name: line
parameter.description: The line number with the error.

parameter.name: column
parameter.description: The column number with the error.

parameter.name: error
parameter.description: The exception returned by the XML parser.

message.message-text: Cannot find device '%devicename%'.

parameter.name: devicename
parameter.description: The device that cannot be found.

message.message-text: The ACDS version [%device_xml_version%] in [%device_xml_path%] does not match the DSPBA version [%dspba_version%] in [%dspba_path%].
No definition found for speed grade '%speedgrade%' in family '%familyname%'.
No definition found for timing model %timingmodel% in speed grade '%speedgrade%' in family '%familyname%'.

parameter.name: timingmodel
parameter.description: The default or selected timing model.

message.message-text: Symmetry type (%type%) did not correspond to symmetry size (%size%).
Sanitised version of '%name%' is empty. Rename to include some alphabetical characters.
Irrecoverable name mapping collision "%name%". Ensure that the alphanumeric parts of block names are unique.
Feature '%feature%' does not have a boolean value.

parameter.name: feature
parameter.description: The feature without a boolean value.

message.message-text: Feature '%feature%' does not have an integer value.

parameter.name: feature
parameter.description: The feature without an integer value.

message.message-text: Cast error in %name%. Conversion from %informat% to %outformat% not found in table.
The coefficients must be a signed fixed point array.
message.suggestion: Try using the fi function to create the array.

message.message-text: Reconfigurable FIRs currently do not support super sample rates.
message.suggestion: Ensure that the total data rate is below the clock rate.

message.message-text: The channel mapping must be a 2D array with each row containing the same number of entries as the total number of channels. Each row represents 1 mode.
message.suggestion: Ensure there is 1 row per mode containing 1 channel per timeslot.

message.message-text: The channels must be integers between the range 0 and Number of Channels - 1
message.suggestion: Ensure all entries are integers

message.message-text: Generation stopped.
Folded primitive subsystems must only have one ChannelIn block, but two were found: '%blockone%' and '%blocktwo%'.
Folded primitive subsystems must only have one ChannelOut block, but two were found: '%blockone%' and '%blocktwo%'.
Folded primitive subsystems must have one ChannelIn block, but none were found.
Folded primitive subsystems must have one ChannelOut block, but none were found.

Folding parameters must be set to the same values in the ChannelIn and the ChannelOut block of a folded primitive subsystem, but ChannelIn '%channelinblock%' has Number of Used TDM Slots set to %inslots% and ChannelOut '%channeloutblock%' has it set to %outslots%.

parameter.description: The number of TDM slots set on the ChannelIn block.

parameter.name: outslots
parameter.description: The number of TDM slots set on the ChannelOut block.

message.message-text: Folding parameters must be set to the same values in the ChannelIn and the ChannelOut block of a folded primitive subsystem, but ChannelIn '%channelinblock%' has Sample Rate set to %inrate%.2f and ChannelOut '%channeloutblock%' has it set to %outrate%.2f.

parameter.name: inrate
parameter.description: The sample rate set on the ChannelIn block.

parameter.name: outrate
parameter.description: The sample rate set on the ChannelOut block.

parameter.description: The input port connected to the ChannelIn output port.

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: The block which has an input port that is connected to the ChannelIn output port.

message.message-text: Model '%modelName%' has an invalid domain boundary specification on it. The incorrect specification has the DSDK value '%boundarySpec%'. The signpost on the specification has an invalid value '%signpost%'

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.description: Name of the model with incorrect domain boundary specification

parameter.name: signpost
parameter.description: DSDK value of the domain signpost

message.message-text: Model '%modelName%' has an invalid domain boundary specification on it. The incorrect specification has the DSDK value '%boundarySpec%'. The signpost on the specification has an invalid value '%signpost%': The block with name '%blockName%' couldn't be found in the model.

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.description: Name of the model with incorrect domain boundary specification

parameter.name: signpost
parameter.description: DSDK value of the domain signpost

parameter.name: blockName
parameter.description: Name of the block not found

message.message-text: Model '%modelName%' has an invalid domain boundary specification on it. The incorrect specification has the DSDK value '%boundarySpec%'. The signpost on the specification has an invalid value '%signpost%'. The wire with name '%wireName%' couldn't be found on the block with name '%blockName%'.

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.description: Name of the model with incorrect domain boundary specification

parameter.name: signpost
parameter.description: DSDK value of the domain signpost

parameter.name: blockName
parameter.description: Name of the block with the wire that couldn't be found

parameter.name: wireName
parameter.description: Name of the wire not found

message.message-text: Model '%modelName%' has an invalid domain boundary specification on it. The incorrect specification has the DSDK value '%boundarySpec%'. The signpost on the specification has an invalid value '%signpost%'. The port with name '%portName%' couldn't be found on the block with name '%blockName%'.

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.description: Name of the model with incorrect domain boundary specification

parameter.name: signpost
parameter.description: DSDK value of the domain signpost

parameter.name: blockName
parameter.description: Name of the block with the port that couldn't be found

parameter.name: portName
parameter.description: Name of the port not found

message.message-text: Model '%modelName%' specifies multiple domain signposts at the same point on block '%blockName%'.

Domain propagation error within model '%modelName%'. Attempting to overwrite an already determined domain on port '%portName%' of block '%blockName%'. The existing domain on the port is '%existingDomain%'. The domain that was trying to overwrite this is '%overwritingDomain%'.

Domain propagation error within model '%modelName%'. Attempting to overwrite an already determined domain on wire '%wireName%' of block '%blockName%'. The existing domain on the wire is '%existingDomain%'. The domain that was trying to overwrite this is '%overwritingDomain%'.
Attempting to flatten model '%srcModel%' into its parent, but '%srcModel%' has domain information specified on the input and/or output blocks which would be lost in the process.
Attempting to propagate an invalid type to a sensitive unit block to port '%portName%'. The required type for this port is '%requiredType%', but the type being forward to it is '%forwardingType%'.

parameter.name: forwardingType
parameter.description: Type being forward to the port

message.message-text: Model [%model%] referenced by %refer% blocks but schedule inlined by %inline%. When inlining a model's schedule, the sub-hierarchy must be a tree.

parameter.name: inline
parameter.description: Number of model blocks configured to inline the schedule of this model

parameter.name: refer
parameter.description: number of model blocks referencing this model

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an output with a name which is not a 2-tuple ('%outputName%'). Generally the names of outputs should look like this: (A_WIRE_STALL, 0). This would indicate stall output number 0 on the StallValidConnector block. The number is required.

parameter.name: outputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an output(wire) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an output with an invalid name ('%outputName%'). This output name is correctly a 2-tuple, but the first element of the tuple needs to be either A_WIRE_VALID or A_WIRE_STALL.

parameter.name: outputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an output(wire) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an output with an invalid name ('%outputName%'). The second element of the 2-tuple needs to be an integer.

parameter.name: outputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an output(wire) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an output with an invalid name ('%outputName%'). The second element of the 2-tuple needs to be a positive integer.

parameter.name: outputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an output(wire) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an invalid numbering on its output stall and/or valid wires. The numbers should be consecutive and start from 0.

StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an input with a name which is not a 2-tuple ('%inputName%'). Generally the names of inputs should look like this: (A_PORT_STALL, 0). This would indicate stall input number 0 on the StallValidConnector block. The number is required.

parameter.name: inputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an input(port) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an input with an invalid name ('%inputName%'). This input name is correctly a 2-tuple, but the first element of the tuple needs to be either A_PORT_VALID or A_PORT_STALL.

parameter.name: inputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an input(port) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an input with an invalid name ('%inputName%'). The second element of the 2-tuple needs to be an integer.

parameter.name: inputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an input(port) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an input with an invalid name ('%inputName%'). The second element of the 2-tuple needs to be a positive integer.

parameter.name: inputName
parameter.description: The invalid name of an input(port) on the block

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has an invalid numbering on its input stall and/or valid ports. The numbers should be consecutive and start from 0.

StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has a mismatch in the number of input valid and output stall signals it has. It has %numValidInputs% input valid signals and %numStallOutputs% output stall signals. It should have the same number of each.

StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has a mismatch in the number of signals it has. It has %numValidInputs% input valid, %numEmptyInputs% input empty, and %numAlmostEmptyInputs% input almost empty signals and %numStallOutputs% output stall signals. It should have the same number of each.

parameter.name: numAlmostEmptyInputs
parameter.description: Number of almost empty input signals

message.message-text: StallValidConnector block named '%block%' must only have stall outputs in enabled models. It has %numValidOutputs% output valid signals, %numStallInputs% input stall signals and %numValidInputs% input valid signals.

StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has a mismatch in the number of output valid and input stall signals it has. It has %numValidOutputs% output valid signals and %numStallInputs% input stall signals. It should have the same number of each.

StallValidConnector block named '%block%' has a mismatch in the number of signals it has. It has %numValidOutputs% output valid, %numEmptyOutputs% output empty, and %numAlmostEmptyOutputs% output almost empty signals and %numStallInputs% input stall signals. It should have the same number of each.

parameter.name: numAlmostEmptyOutputs
parameter.description: Number of almost empty output signals

message.message-text: Unsupported block ('%block%') with type '%blockType%' found within Stall/Valid region of model '%model%'. This block type is not supported within Stall/Valid regions.

Unexpected StallEnter or StallExit block '%block%' found in model '%model%'. Please ensure all StallEnter and StallExit boundary blocks delineating the same Stall/Valid region are found in the same model. The top level model for the relevant Stall/Valid region in this case is '%topModel%'

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: Name of the Stall/Valid boundary block

parameter.name: topModel
parameter.description: Name of the model which expects the Stall/Valid boundary blocks

message.message-text: Trying to create a QueryPoint for a model input which doesn't exist. The model is '%model%' and the input name is '%inputName%'.
Trying to create a QueryPoint for a model output which doesn't exist. The model is '%model%' and the output name is '%outputName%'.
Trying to create a QueryPoint for a type of block which doesn't support it. The block is named '%block%', is within the model named '%model%' and is of type '%blockType%'.
Unable to find a path between two points the a capacity was requested between.
ECC sink block named '%block%' is not connected.
message.suggestion: Remove the ECC sink block or connect it to ECC output ports of submodels or external IP blocks

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: Name of the ECC sink block

message.message-text: Two SharedMems found with address ranges that do not overlap exactly. SharedMem %block1% has the address range %from1% to %to1% and SharedMem %block2% has the address range %from2% to %to2%.
message.suggestion: SharedMems can only overlap their addresses exactly; change one of the SharedMem's address range to match the other.

message.message-text: With bit-slicing enabled, SharedMem blocks can only have auto-generated linear address maps. SharedMem %block% has a user defined address map.
message.suggestion: In the "Memory Mapped Address" field, replace the custom address map vector with a single address offset.

message.message-text: Inconsistent bit-slice specification for the SharedMem %block%. With bit-slicing enabled, a SharedMem block's width must be equal to or less than the bus width, its LSB must be less than or equal to its MSB, its LSB must be greater than or equal to 0, and the bit-slice width must equal the data type width.
message.suggestion: Review the MSB and LSB settings in the block parameters.

message.message-text: The identifier '%id%' is invalid, for the '%interface%'.
message.suggestion: Change the identifier name.

message.message-text: The beta block '%block%' is invalid.
message.suggestion: Replace the beta block with the release version.

message.message-text: This device family does not support block '%block%' %attribute% using %mode%.
message.suggestion: Change the settings on this block or change the way in which the block is used (or the targeted device family), if possible.

message.message-text: Memory '%block%' is an uninitialised ROM.
message.suggestion: Make the memory writeable and/or initialise the memory content.

message.message-text: Could not create directory %directory%'.
Could not copy %fromfile% to %tofile%'.
Model '%model%' depends on unfound scheduled model '%wantedModel%'.
message.suggestion: Check the name of the depended-upon model.

message.message-text: Model '%model%' depends reflexively upon itself.
message.suggestion: Remove the cyclic latency dependency.

message.message-text: Dependency cycle(s) found involving %cycleSize% models, including '%model%'.
message.suggestion: Remove the cyclic latency dependency.

message.message-text: Model '%model%' depends on CIC Model IP - a CIC does not have a simple latency definition to depend upon.
Model '%model%' depends on incompatibly configured FIR Model IP - this FIR does not have a simple latency definition to depend upon.
Model '%model%' depends on SharedFIFO Model IP - a SharedFIFO does not have a simple latency definition to depend upon.
Model '%dependentModel%' depends upon model '%badModel%' which does not have a single well-defined latency.
Model '%model%' is constrained to depend-upon another but itself may not have a simple singular latency and so it may not respect that constraint
The depth of SharedFIFO [%block%] must be greater than or equal to %depth%.
The depth %depth% of SharedFIFO [%block%] is not a power of two.
SharedFIFO sample times must be greater than 0.
SharedFIFO sample times must be different.
SharedFIFO [%block%] sample time ratio %ratio% (larger/smaller) must be an integer.
SharedFIFO [%block%] sample time ratio %ratio% (larger/smaller) must be a power of two.
SharedFIFO [%block%] sample time ratio %ratio% (larger/smaller) must be less than or equal to 32.
Write to SharedFIFO [%block%] while it is full.
The external clock name %extClkName% of SharedFIFO [%block%] is already used.

parameter.name: extClkName
parameter.description: external clock name that is in use

message.message-text: In Conduit interface %interfaceName%, the ports %portOneName% and %portTwoName% have the same role.
message.suggestion: Ensure that the names of the ChannelIn, ChannelOut, GPIn, GPOut or ModelIP blocks connected to these ports have uniques names within the entire Simulink design.

message.message-text: The bus block [%block%] is wider than twice the width of the bus. Bus blocks must be less than or equal to twice the bus width.
message.suggestion: Reduce the bit-width of this block or increase the width of the bus.

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: The block with width > 2 * bus width

message.message-text: Subsystem input/output block [%block_path%] is not supported for synthesis
Simulink Bus Creator [%block%] must be configured as "Inherit: auto"
A bit-accurate simulation model does not exist for the model [%model%]. Please enable bit-accurate simulation setting on the SynthesisInfo block.
Block [%path%] is deprecated. %specifics%
message.suggestion: Deprecated blocks should be replaced.

message.message-text: Design contains an obsolete block [%block%].
message.suggestion: Obsolete blocks should be removed.

message.message-text: Trying to generate HDLExpression for InPort but it has no net or its net is not driven. This will almost always produce invalid HDL output unless the expression is ignored.
Trying to generate HDLExpression for OutPort but it has no net or its net is not driven. This will almost always produce invalid HDL output unless the expression is ignored.
Attempting to use flexible delay [%block%] in unscheduled primitive subsystem
block '%path%' requires a complex input, but the signal driving it is real.
Failed to locate Registered Model for S-Function '%sfunction%'.

parameter.name: sfunction
parameter.description: The S-Function without a registered model

message.message-text: Found variable DSPBA_Features in base workspace, but it is not of type 'struct'. Ignoring it.
Found variable DSPBA_Features in base workspace, but it does not have exactly one element. Ignoring it.
Field '%fieldname%' in DSPBA_Features is a non-scalar double. Ignoring.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.description: The field which is a non-scalar double.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.description: The field which is a non-scalar logical.

message.message-text: Subfield '%subfieldname%' of field '%fieldname%' in DSPBA_Features is not a string. Ignoring.

parameter.description: The name of the subfield containing the offending field.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.description: The field which is not a string.

parameter.description: The cell array field with a non-string component

parameter.name: cellelementtype
parameter.description: The type of the cell array element which is not a string

parameter.description: The index into the cell array which contains a non-string

message.message-text: Field '%fieldname%' in DSPBA_Features is of unsupported type '%fieldtype%'. Ignoring.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.description: The field which is not a string.

parameter.name: fieldtype
parameter.description: The field type which is not supported.

message.message-text: Feature %feature% expects a struct, but is of a different type.

parameter.name: feature
parameter.description: The feature which does not have a struct type.

message.message-text: Feature %feature% expects a list of strings in a cell array, but is of a different type.

parameter.name: feature
parameter.description: The feature which does not have a list type.

message.message-text: The Complex To Real-Imag block '%blockname%' has a non-inherited 'Sample time'. Only inherited sample times are currently supported (-1). The parameter will be ignored in generated hardware, with the result the simulation result in Simulink may differ from hardware.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: The complex to real-imag block in question.

message.message-text: The Real-Imag To Complex block '%blockname%' has a non-inherited 'Sample time'. Only inherited sample times are currently supported (-1). The parameter will be ignored in generated hardware, with the result the simulation result in Simulink may differ from hardware.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: The real-imag to complex block in question.

message.message-text: '%portname%': Ignoring port at the top level.

parameter.name: portname
parameter.description: The port which will be ignored.

message.message-text: Ignoring Enable port for subsystem '%subsystemname%'.
Ignoring Trigger port for subsystem '%subsystemname%'.
Ignoring second definition of speed grade '%speedgrade%'.
Error occured executing model %modelname%, at time step %timestep%, error: %error%.

parameter.name: modelname
parameter.description: The name of the model with an error.

parameter.name: timestep
parameter.description: The timestep at which the error occured.

parameter.name: error
parameter.description: The text of the error thrown.

message.message-text: Failed to create Filter with these parameters: Error: %error%.

parameter.name: error
parameter.description: The text of the error thrown.

message.message-text: Cast error in %name%. Conversion from %informat% to %outformat% not found in table.
Negative IO correction on block %block%. Simulink will not match hardware.
Port %port%(%element%,%complex%) on %block% appears to be unconnected. This is currently unsupported and could lead to instability.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: index of input port on block

message.message-text: Ports %portA% and %portB% on %block% have incompatible dimensionalities.
Block '%block%' has a name containing only whitespace characters.
[2] The clock rate (%clock%) is smaller than the sample rate (%sample%). Setting folding factor to 1.

parameter.name: sample
parameter.description: sample rate used to determine folding factor

message.message-text: Read acknowledge received by FIFO %path% when valid output is still low at time %time%.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: the cycle in which the read acknowlgement was received

message.message-text: Some user inserted SampleDelays have been optimized away. The latency on the valid path across primitive subsystem '%subsystem%' in hardware will be 0, which may differ from the simulation model. If you need to preserve extra SampleDelays in this case, use the 'Constraint Latency' option on the SynthesisInfo block.

parameter.name: subsystem
parameter.description: name of scheduled primitive subsystem with too many sample delays

message.message-text: The NCO %modelname% is specified with writable registers and an accumulator of width %accumwidth%. This requires addressable registers of width %regwidth%, which is not supported using a bus of width %buswidth%.
message.suggestion: Try increasing the bus width specified in the Avalon Interfaces menu.

parameter.name: accumwidth
parameter.description: specified width of NCO accumulator (in bits)

message.message-text: Found Run all ATBs block %blockname%. This block is deprecated and will be removed in future versions of DSP Builder Advanced. Remove this block and use the Verify Model option on the DSP Builder menu instead.

parameter.name: blockname
parameter.description: name of the run all ATBS block

message.message-text: The Valid port of %block% is connected to a signal of invalid type %type%.
message.suggestion: Connect the Valid port to a signal of type boolean or ufix1.

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: Path to block where problem detected

message.message-text: The Channel port of %block% is connected to a signal of invalid type %type%.
message.suggestion: Connect the Channel port to a signal of type uint8 or ufix8.

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: Path to block where problem detected

message.message-text: The Start of Packet port of %block% is connected to a signal of invalid type %type%.
message.suggestion: Connect the Start of Packet port to a signal of type boolean or ufix1.

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: Path to block where problem detected

message.message-text: Device ATB is unable to access any input stimulus files.
Device ATB is unable to access any output stimulus files.
Clock domains for '%clock0%' and '%clock1%' have come into contact without appropriate clock crossing at block '%block%'. Try using a DualMem to cross clocks.

parameter.name: block
parameter.description: Path to block where problem detected

message.message-text: Could not open file %filename% for HDL output.
message.suggestion: Please ensure the path to the file is correct and the file is present.

message.message-text: A StallEntry or StallExit block's control ports must be connected to a signal of type boolean or ufix1.
Sample Delay %block% in [%model%] has minimum length of 0. This is not guaranteed to work with bit accurate simulation. Either enable cycle accurate simulation or use a non-zero minimum length delay.
Individual ATB for model %model% is disabled because it contains one or more ModelBus blocks. Please use the device-level ATB to verify your design.
Write received by FIFO %path% when FIFO is full at time %time%.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: the cycle in which the write request was received

message.message-text: Block(s) which must run at the clock rate found in the same design as an ALU Folder system at the data rate.
message.suggestion: Please be aware that interfacing data rate signals to/from a folded system with other parts of the design at the clock rate may lead to unexpected behaviour. The "clock rate" option for the ALU Folder is recommended for interfacing between ALU Folder systems and other parts of the design.

message.message-text: Multiple ALU Folder systems which are set to run at the "data rate" are present, and which are running at different rates.
Multiple ALU Folder systems which are set to run at the "data rate" are present. The device level ModelSim ATB might not work. Try running ModelSim ATBs of individual models to verify your design.
Scaling by constant %constant% in ConstMult [%block%] will saturate output type %sign%fix%bitwidth%%fraction%

parameter.name: sign
parameter.description: sign of output fixed point type

parameter.name: fraction
parameter.description: fraction spec of output fixed point type

message.message-text: Output fixed point type of ConstMult [%block%] is expected to be signed
FIFO %block% depth parameter value %oldVal% must be greater or equal to 2. The depth of this FIFO has been reset to %newVal%

parameter.name: oldVal
parameter.description: Original value of the depth parameter

parameter.name: newVal
parameter.description: New value of the depth parameter

message.message-text: FIFO %block% threshold parameter value %oldVal% must be in the range [0,depth]. The threshold of this FIFO has been reset to %newVal%

parameter.name: oldVal
parameter.description: Original value of the threshold parameter

parameter.name: newVal
parameter.description: New value of the threshold parameter

parameter.name: oldVal
parameter.description: Original value of the fill_threshold parameter

parameter.name: newVal
parameter.description: New value of the fill_threshold parameter

message.message-text: The primitive block multiply-accumulate/accumulate is not supported on this architecture.
message.suggestion: Use a target device that has hardware floating-point DSP support, such as Arria10.

parameter.description: Name of the external IP block

Modifying wire '%wire%' on block '%block%'. Existing type was '%oldType%'. New type is '%newType%'.

Clock name not set for model '%model%'.

message.message-text: The block '%block%' is placed outside scheduled subsystem. Inputs will not be automatically balanced.
DSPBA_Features field '%fieldname%' collides with another field name when case insensitive comparison is applied.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.description: Name of DSPBA feature that is causing the collision with another field name

message.message-text: Non-ideal '%nonideal%' employed instead of '%ideal%' in '%block%'.
message.suggestion: No action - it should still work.

message.message-text: Constant block '%block%' does not have a type set, unable to check for saturation.
Constant block '%block%' constant value contains an unexpected type. Expected type [%expected%] but found value [%actual%].

parameter.name: expected
parameter.description: Expected type of the constant block value

parameter.name: actual
parameter.description: Actual value of the constant block value

message.message-text: Constant block '%block%' with the value %value% has saturated due to insufficient bit-width (%bitwidth% bits available, %required% bits required).
message.suggestion: Increase the bit-width or disable this warning in the block parameters.

parameter.name: required
parameter.description: Number of bits needed to avoid saturation

message.message-text: Constant at index %index% in block '%block%' with the value %value% has saturated due to insufficient bit-width (%bitwidth% bits available, %required% bits required).
message.suggestion: Increase the bit-width or disable this warning in the block parameters.

parameter.name: required
parameter.description: Number of bits needed to avoid saturation

message.message-text: The %component% part of constant block '%block%' with the value %value% has saturated due to insufficient bit-width (%bitwidth% bits available, %required% bits required).
message.suggestion: Increase the bit-width or disable this warning in the block parameters.

parameter.name: required
parameter.description: Number of bits needed to avoid saturation

message.message-text: The %component% part of constant at index %index% of block '%block%' with the value %value% has saturated due to insufficient bit-width (%bitwidth% bits available, %required% bits required).
message.suggestion: Increase the bit-width or disable this warning in the block parameters.

parameter.name: required
parameter.description: Number of bits needed to avoid saturation

message.message-text: Model '%model%' has a 'valid' output that is discarded within the scope of the DSP Builder design. This means that the whole of this model will be considered Data-Flow and reset-minimized.
message.suggestion: Fully connect the 'valid' output (within the scope of DSP Builder) if you intend for it to convey Control-Flow information. Leave the design as it is if you intend this model to have no 'valid' Control-Flow.

message.message-text: Address port %addr% on DualMem block '%block%' is larger than required to access all addresses and will be truncated to %bits% bits. You may be trying to access addresses beyond the memory's range.
message.suggestion: Change the data type of the source block or insert a ChooseBits block.

message.message-text: Address port %addr% on DualMem block '%block%' is smaller than required to access all addresses and will be zero-padded to %bits% bits. You cannot access all addresses from this port.
message.suggestion: Change the data type of the source block.

message.message-text: Address out of range: Attempted to %rw% DualMem '%path%' location %address% at tick %time%. Valid address range is from 0 to %upperBound%.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: The cycle in which the address was out of range

message.message-text: Read/Write address clash in a 'DONT_CARE' memory '%path%' at address1=%addressA% and address2=%addressB% at tick %time%. The memory is marked as 'DONT_CARE' so this read value must not be relied upon (it has been zeroed in the Simulink Simulation but the HW behaviour is undefined).
message.suggestion: Possible solutions are: ensure the read value is 'not used' in these circumstances; refactor so that the read address is different when there is a write; untick DONT_CARE.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: The cycle in which the r/w address clash occurred

message.message-text: Memory %path% is marked as 'uninitialized' and the meaning of 'uninitialized' has been set to 'X - Truly Uninitialized'. Simulink and HDL simulation will mismatch if an uninitialized location is read and used.
message.suggestion: To ensure a system simulation match, do not allow uninitialized data to propagate so as to influence an output; for example use a Mux. (In a SharedMem with bus read, connected bus logic may need to cope with reading Xs.)

message.message-text: Device %device% does not support %wantLanguage%, instead %gotLanguage% will be used.
message.suggestion: Select a supported language for this device.

message.message-text: The FIFO %block% reached a maximum depth of %usedDepth% out of %configDepth%.

parameter.name: configDepth
parameter.description: the configured depth of the FIFO

message.message-text: The vector element %numElement% of FIFO %block% reached a maximum depth of %usedDepth% out of %configDepth%.

parameter.name: configDepth
parameter.description: the configured depth of the FIFO

parameter.name: numElement
parameter.description: the element number in a vector

message.message-text: The reset duration for %model% is %len%.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: Model to which reset duration applies

message.message-text: The value of the %name% is %value%.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the attribute being reported

message.message-text: Test message: parameter 1 is %param1%, parameter 2 is %param2%.
message.suggestion: No suggestion, this is a test.
